description: 1975 Mercedes Benz 300D
Finished in Colorado Beige exterior with Saddle Tan MB-Tex interior
Presented in mostly overall original and well cared for correct condition
3 owner car and resided with the same family for 23 years!
Always garaged, well maintained and all service recorded in great detail
W115 U.S. specification 300D
Bosch 3.0L SOHC 5-cylinder diesel engine
4-Speed Automatic Transmission
Power steering and brakes
Factory air conditioning
Aftermarket cruise control

MotoeXotica Classic Cars is pleased to present this amazing original condition 1975 Mercedes-Benz 300D. This Colorado Beige Benz defies its age and it shows because it was always garaged and lovingly cared for by the same family for 23 years! Mr. Mulch purchased this 300D from the original owner on May 3, 1982 with a current odometer reading of 69,412 miles and during his ownership put another 93,462 miles traveling around the country with his wife until his passing in 2005. During the 23 years of ownership Mr. Mulch kept a auto record diary that he recorded every detail of the care and use of this 300D, he averaged around 26 mpg during his entire ownership and recorded every single time he drove the Mercedes and where to! He also listed in great detail every time he changed the oil and valve adjustments religiously along with all other routine service work and repairs. The third owner was an elderly women who purchased the 300D from the Mulch estate in 2006 and sparingly drove the 300D on the occasion Sunday and only put just a little over 2k miles on the car during her 10 years of ownership and always stored in a garage. This 300D is a prime example of a classic benefiting from well cared for long term ownership and is a genuine time capsule from the 1970's.

In 1975, Mercedes-Benz big diesel news came in however, when Mercedes grafted another cylinder to the new diesel four to create a 3.0-liter straight five diesel making 77 horsepower, at the time, the most power available in a diesel passenger car.

Finished in its correct shade of Colorado Beige (code 470), the paint job is beautiful and presents itself extremely well with a nice shine. Front bumper has a good fit, with rubber over riders, the rear bumper (with the same over riders) has a excellent fit and finish that shows well with only minor imperfections. All trim pieces are present and have a brilliant finish with little hazing and or dent that we could see. The weather stripping is still very pliable with no shrinkage or drying and the front and rear windshield seals are in great shape. The U.S. spec headlights, bumper mounted driving lights and taillights are in very condition with no hazing or cracks.

Inside, the rich Saddle tan (code 104) MB-Tex vinyl seats all look great with no major signs of wear visible. Excellent matching carpet throughout the interior. Overall the genuine wood trim looks great.. The door panels and dashboard are matched perfectly with the exterior of the car and look fantastic. The headliner mirrors the rest of the cabin and completes the theme. The original steering wheel in great condition, air conditioning, heater, power windows, power locks, period correct Yamaha AM/FM cassette player and even an early version of aftermarket cruise control. As known with these W114/W115 Mercedes models blower motors can be very pricey to repair and this 300D ‘s blower motor has been tested and operates as originally designed.

This nicely presented Mercedes is equipped with the Bosch injected 3.0L inline 5-cylinder diesel engine, 4-speed automatic transmission and independent suspension. The drivers assist features include power steering, power brakes and cruise control. 14-inch OEM steel wheels with matching Colorado Beige full Mercedes hub caps on white walled Michelins.

Rarely will you get the opportunity to own an always garaged, un-restored original Mercedes. Ideal for cross- town or cross-country, this 300D is the way it's suppose to be understated elegance… GET OUT AND DRIVE! Also included is the original owners manual and auto diary!

Current mileage on the odometer shows 65,609 miles but the odometer has had one rollover so the mileage is 165,609 and is actual mileage according to the diligent notes of the owners log book.  It is sold as is on a clean & clear title.
Mercedes 1982 240D

It has a 4-speed manual transmission, PS/AC, New Alpine AM/FM/Single CD –MP3/WAV radio. Has central locking system, manual windows, manual sun roof. All rust removed and painted in a body restoration paint shop.  In very good condition.  It gets about 33 miles per gallon of diesel highway, 28-30 miles local. Clean interior, garage kept and not driven in rain or snow.

Many items just repaired/replaced: new water pump, new glow plugs, new air conditioning compressor conforming to standards, new motor mounts, oil change, fuel filter change, central locking system repaired. Fuel tank removed and cleaned.
Not many Manual Drive cars are available. Fun to drive and a good collector's car. Must be seen to be appreciated.
SWEET Mercedes 450 SL.... BOTH TOPS ... FULL Mercedes options ... cruise this summer in top down mercedes COMFORT AND class..... priced to SELL!!
1981 Mercedes-Benz 300D For Sale in Torrance, California 90504

This 1981 Mercedes-Benz 300D has been extremely well maintained, in perfect showroom condition!  It has all original paint in mint condition with absolutely no rust on this well maintained California car. The interior is immaculate with not a blemish in sight  The flawless tan paint hugs the classic body style of this German touring car in a pristine manner and is complimented by a luxurious brown and wood grain interior. Powered by the legendary Mercedes Benz 3 liter inline 5 cylinder diesel engine with only 190,600 miles on it, you can rest assured that this Benz will take you anywhere your heart desires.

Mercedes-Benz introduced the W123 four-door versions on January 23, 1976. While there were some technical similarities to their predecessors, the new models were larger in wheelbase and exterior dimensions. This car also comes with the original Becker AM/FM stereo with the telescoping antenna which is in great working condition. The AC compressor is new and the system has been converted to R-134, which delivers ice cold air throughout, when your not enjoying the breeze through the open sunroof. There is a new battery, new fuel  lines, the vacuum lines and door lock actuators have all been replaced as well. The vacuum system is in great working condition,the valve cover has been resurfaced, and the gasket has been replaced. These features combined, enable this vehicle to cradle the balance between prestige and power.

You will not find another 1981 Mercedes-Benz 300D in this condition for the asking price, so don't let this one pass you by! The engine has no leaks, it has always been garage kept, and it has never been smoked in.  Call today for more information on how you can get behind the wheel of this illustrious car!!!

1985 MB 380 SL 380 Champagne just arrived!!! Just Serviced....... New Starter, Gaskets, Air Conditioning, Power Windows, Fuel System, Power Brake Booster, Viper Alarm System, and so much more..... Great Original Paint the interior shows some age the rest or the car looks very good. Just 147,307 Miles purrrs like a kitten...........

REDUCED FOR QUICK SALE.  Estate sale survivor. A well-preserved, iron-clad W123 300 Turbo Diesel. These famous million-mile cars are getting harder and harder to locate. If you are viewing this, you know what you are looking at. I will entertain reasonable offers. Will ship world-wide at buyers expense. This 1982 Mercedes-Benz 300D Turbo Diesel sedan in light lapis blue-gray. VIN number is WDBA33A3CB01134 and the odometer reads 174486 at time of cataloging. This automatic transmission car features a straight-five cylinder OM617.952 3.0 liter engine with 125 horsepower, diesel fuel, rear wheel drive, air conditioning, power steering, automatic windows, AM/FM radio, and more. The interior features cream MB Tex.

In running condition. Signs of possible oil leakage under car. Interior is in excellent condition, body has several dings in as shown, surface scratches, wear to plating on wheel rims, wear consistent with age and use. Lights and A/C operational at time of cataloging.  Vehicle is undergoing light reconditioning but will be kept in current condition in case purchaser want to fully restore.  The time and resources for a full-restoration will be minimal given it's survivor state.  I doubt you will find a better candidate for full restoration.  If it does not sell as is, I will continue to complete the full restoration myself as this is the vehicle that will require the least work.  Email or call with any questions.  Additional picture or videos upon request.

This stunningly beautiful 37589 mile Pagoda Top 280 SL with automatic transmission and factory a/c is void of rust and has just been awaken from over ten years of sleeping in the last 40 year owners garage.We just spent close to $10,000 servicing all items that were in need,i.e. fuel system, complete brake system as well as servicing of all components.Gauges all work and are in like new condition.The drive is extraordinary with a tight suspension and smooth shifts.There is no indication of rust repair on the car.The car comes with tool roll and manuals.This is not a restored car but a well cared for example with a short list of ownership history.Review the 47 pictures posted taken in natural light without filters or photoshop.The car is as straight and beautiful in person as reflected in the pictures.The body gaps are good and aluminum panels straight.After reviewing pictures if you have interest ,contact me at 615-971-4409.Independent inspections are welcomed and encouraged.There will be an additional $299 dealer doc fee assessed to final sale price.The car is  located in the Nashville Tn metro area.This and other European collectibles may be reviewed at JPFRAZIER.com
1972 Mercedes Benz 280SEL 4.5
Gray exterior and black leather interior
Powerful 4.5L M117 SOHC V8 Engine (195 hp)
Three-speed automatic transmission
Factory air-conditioning
Power steering, brakes and windows and rear defroster
Many original components, a solid chassis and relatively presentable cosmetic pieces make this 1972 Mercedes-Benz 280SEL 4.5 a worthy restoration project, brought to you by MotoeXotica Classic Cars.

The previous owner, a Mr. Erdos of Holly, Michigan, bought the car a year ago from a neighbor who had stored it in his garage for many years. The seller changed the spark plugs before selling it and the car runs but it will take more restoration efforts to get it to a Mercedes-Benz level of roadworthiness. This example came from the factory with the following options – central locking system, U.S. trim, Becker AM/FM stereo, Thermoking air-conditioning, power windows and green, heat-insulating glass, with rear defroster.

The Mercedes-Benz W108 and W109 vehicles equipped with the 4.5L SOHC cast-iron block m117 V-8 were produced, starting in early 1971, with the 280SE 4.5. The 4.5 engine was released by MB initially for the North American market, to get around the tougher emissions standards without killing the engine output and performance of the 3.5L engine. The m117 4.5 is very similar to the 3.5, with a 30 mm taller stroke. The heads also received larger combustion chambers, lowered compression to 8.8:1 or 8.0:1, depending on engine variation and production date. Power was 230 or 200 horsepower in Europe, depending on compression but 195 horsepower for North America. The D-Jet EFI system was tuned further for the 4.5, with a specific ECU that gave a 10 percent full-throttle enrichment. This (along with a taller rear-end gear) allowed the 4.5 to achieve similar efficiency to the 3.5, yet more power on full throttle. The 3.5 and 4.5 are so similar that 3.5 heads can fit directly on a 4.5 with no modifications for a roughly 11:1 compression ratio!

Believed to have been repainted in its original gray, the paint is in fair shape, with some blemishes visible. Most of the glass is clear and intact but the driver's sideview mirror glass is on the console and the rear window and rear passenger side glass carry aftermarket tinting. The radio aerial is missing but most of the chrome trim is in one piece and serviceable.

The interior is almost 100 percent original, with the exception of a Pioneer AM/FM stereo with CD player and at least four speakers installed in the doors and rear package shelf. The right front passenger headrest is missing but the black leather seats are in good condition, the dashboard is crack-free and its VDO gauges work as designed while the door panels, headliner, the large steering wheel, gearshift lever and upholstery are in decent condition overall. Driver assist features include power steering and power brakes.

The 108 and 109 Chassis Mercedes-Benz vehicles with the 4.5L m117 V-8 are still, to this date, sought after by many people who owned one in the early 1970s (or who had a family member or friend with one). Also, many people who live in Europe are buying rust-free examples from the USA and shipping them back to Europe. The 4.5 wasn't offered in Europe at the time, and it has a possibly stronger following than the 3.5 in Europe. In 1971, the 280 SEL 4.5 sedan was available at the same time as the regular-length 3.5 sedan. The almost four-inch (10-centimeter) difference gave the rear-seat passengers additional space to stretch their legs, a plus on longer journeys. This 4.5-liter engined long sedan outsold the 3.5-liter version by three-to-one in 1971 and the following year, the more powerful version was the choice of more than 6,000 customers while only about 500 people chose the lesser car. Production in 1971-1972 totaled 8,173 units.
Competition to this Mercedes-Benz in 1972 included Jaguar's XJ6 4.2L, BMW's 3.0 S and the Bentley T.

This car is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer 23,649 miles. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear mileage exempt title.
1981 Mercedes-Benz 380 SL, Blue on Tan Leather, Clean Carfax, Automatic, Low 102K miles
1971 Mercedes-Benz 300SEL 3.5 Sedan
Limited production – one of 3,225 models made in 1971
One of the highly desirable flagship models with a M116 3.5L SOHC V-8 engine with Bosch D-Jetronic fuel injection
Four-speed automatic transmission
Air suspension
Horizon Blue (DB-304) exterior with Deep Blue leather interior
Power steering, power, power four-wheel disc brakes and power windows
Factory air-conditioning, power windows, pneumatic power locks
Original tool roll, warning triangle, Bilstein jack and factory first-aid kit

MotoeXotica Classic Cars has sold many Mercedes-Benzes but few as nice as this one. We are very excited to present this 1971 300SEL 3.5 sedan. One of Mercedes' flagship models, it was only one of 3,225 models made in 1971.

Dressed in Horizon Blue paint (DB-304), the exterior is in very good condition, with only minor blemishes visible upon close inspection. The windows are all in fine shape, with no cracking or haze evident. The car's lights are in fine condition, intact and clear. The car rides on factory alloy rims surrounded by 205/70R14 tires, Bridgestone Potenza RE86s in front and Michelin MXVs in back. The car's body panels are straight and the bumpers shine brightly. In the well-kept trunk are a first-aid kit, a factory tool roll, a warning triangle and a Bilstein jack, plus a full-sized spare tire. The engine bay is in decent condition while the battery appears new. Driver assist features include air-conditioning, power steering, power brakes and power windows and pneumatic power locks.
It is fitted with the powerful and highly desirable 3.5-liter V-8 engine mated to a four-speed automatic transmission and is remarkably well preserved.

Inside, the deep blue leather seats are in fine order as is the matching carpet. The headliners, four-spoke steering wheel, door panels, package shelf, mirrors, center console and gear shifter are all in a similar state. Rounding out the interior is a Becker Europa II AM/FM stereo. This example has a sumptuous leather and burled walnut interior, which is reportedly “some of the finest woodwork to ever be in a German car.”

The Mercedes-Benz W109 is a luxury car produced from 1965 through to 1972 in North America. The cars were successful in West Germany and in export markets, including North America. The W109s carried over many of the basic engineering principles from previous models, but had many refinements to make them some of the most well-equipped cars of the era. They were top-of-the-line, luxuriously appointed and more advanced than the 280SE 3.5 sedan in chassis design and with its longer wheelbase, a better ride. It shared the air suspension from the 6.3 sedan along with some of its other technological improvements. The more powerful 300SE and 300SEL models were classified as the W109 chassis, with front and rear air suspension (rather than the coil spring-based W108 rear suspension), and available burled walnut interior trim, automatic transmission and power windows.
Competition to this car in 1971 included Bentley's T, BMW's 2000 Sedan and Jaguar's XJ6 sedan.

This car is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows 36,485 miles. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear, mileage exempt title. GET OUT AND DRIVE!!!
